Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Angela G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden Manor for 5 nights in April. The rooms were excellent, lovely high ceilings and very modern. The staff were ++ friendly... when we wanted to change rooms after the first night, this was no problem, moved to a suite at not a great deal more than the cost of the original room. The receptionists and the concierge were extremely helpful always. Highly recommended - would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: charliej82
Reviews.Content: this hotel was brilliant. the staff were so friendly and spoke perfect english. they kept our bags before we could check in so we could go out and check in when we wanted. the room was spotlessly clean and perfectly maintained. it has a tv with bbc one and two. the bathroom was gorgeous although you can see into the bathroom from the room hallway (not good if staying with anyone except your partner) but this can be easily worked around but not exactly a great design feature. we never ate or went into the dining room or bar and we never had and food there. would definetly stay here again. its really easy to get to from central station by taking tram 9. when you get off the hotel is just across the road slightly in front of you. our room was overlooking a courtyard garden and it was amazingly quiet with no sounds throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: oliva
Reviews.Content: WeÂ´ve been in this hotel 4 nights this Easter. We had a enormous nice and cozy room in one corner of the top floor. Bathroom was big too, with both shower and bath tube. Toilet was separated and located at the room entrance. Service was good, they deeply apologized for not having a cradle waiting for us in the room when we arrived. The hotel is not centrally located, but youÂ´ve got a nice walk near the Plantages, and Artis zoo, and also a tram takes you to the centre every 15 minutes (on holidays, more often on week days). The tram stop is almost in front of the hotel. There are a few places to have breakfast, a drink or lunch around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Ambergfornow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because a family member was staying there while attending a conference. Overall it is not bad but it does not meet standards of an excellent hotel. Yes it is clean. Rooms were average but the lobby was substandard, no comfortable chairs or meeting place. Our tv never worked properly it had to be plugged and unplugged multiple times for it to work. The bathroom is odd, no privacy windows looking in the bathroom (maybe trying mimic the Redlight). The breakfast was average, had to ask 2 days for the fruit bowl to be filled. One of the coffee machines has scotch tape holding together. Not a big deal but not what one expects for the price. Whe we arrived we were informed we were upgraded, thank you, the when I asked for basic toiletries I was told they do not provide toiletries to "standard rooms"??? Were we upgraded from a substandard room. Staff was hit and miss, some very helpful others with no interest or clue what a tourist would need. One other complaint was when I made my reservation, I was told no parking available with hotel. On arrival I asked for recommendations for parking the clerk looked up and said their parking was filled until the day before we left and since I did not make any reservations no space for us. I will not stay at this hotel again, I may find on my next stay that it was ok for Amsterdam but I cannot recommend.

Reviews.Title: “definately coming back again”
Reviews.Author: YianieKualaLumpur
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel in july 2011. didn't manage to find a lot of review back then because it was just renovated. Room was lovely. Spacious. Clean. Toilet is clean. shower is functional. no issue with hot water. Staff was fantastic and helpful. Breakfast was good. Close to trams. Definately going to here again when i am back!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: suem60
Reviews.Content: just returned from trip to amsterdam.stayed at the manor hotel for 2nights,room was amazing,you could see into the bathroom from thebed(toilet separate)the rest of the hotel was very clean and modern and the staff were very helpful.the bed was fabulously comfortable and the bedlinen spotlessly clean.would definitly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Funky decor!”
Reviews.Author: Jen134
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! stayed for 3 nights at the end of Feb '12 and enjoyed every minute! The staff were very friendly and helpful, giving us a map and showing the best places to visit and how to use the trams. The room was fab! very modern with a beautiful giant photo over the bed (different one in every room apparently), the bathroom was spotless with lovely toiletries. the only downside with the room was that we had 2 single beds put together. would have been better as a proper double although the mattresses were extremely comfortable! Breakfast was quite pricey but there was plenty of it and it was very tasty. (and to be honest, we found Amsterdam to be quite pricey all over!) Again, the Enoteca restaurantin the hotel was pricey and the service, although friendly,was a tad slow but the food was excellent! i thought the location was great. tram stop just outside where the no9 goes all the way to Centraal Station taking in a lot of tourist sights on the way (the zoo, Rembrandt square, Dam square etc). change at Alexandria sq to the no10 which takes you to the museum district. Highly recommend this hotel! thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, shame about the service.”
Reviews.Author: ctom1989
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went on a short break to Amsterdam, staying here for 5 nights. As two females travelling alone we were very wary of being conned out of our money. On arrival we went to the desk. The woman behind the desk asked us to pay a 300 Euro deposit immediately which was not on the booking confirmation at all (incase we used any hotel ameneties). Of course being asked to pay 300 Euros cash, I immediately refused. After a short argument with the woman behind the desk, I was then asked if I had a debit card - which I would have thought they would have suggested in the first place when we said it would be most of our spending money gone and there was no point getting it back the day we were leaving. Eventually after being told we may have to leave this hotel if we refused to pay up, they accepted a credit card details as security incase we did spend anything. Beware of this, the member of staff was very insistent on the cash! After this long debate which went on for at least ten minutes, where I offered to speak to the manager myself, we had to wait for our luggage to be put into the luggage room. We were waiting where we were asked to, when a woman with a breakfast trolley dashed through carelessly, running over my bags and coat which had been waiting on the floor for at least 5 minutes. Aside from our initial ordeal, the hotel was bizarrely but very modernly decorated. The room was spacious and there was plenty of room for both mine and my friend's cases on the floor. The bathroom was clean, the shower was excellent. The only strange thing was that there was a window looking into the bathroom - a bit strange! My advice would be not to stay here with a business colleague! The hotel also had good tea and coffee facilities, lifts to all floors and easy transport access into Amsterdam. It was a nice quiet place to stay. I would recommend the hotel however I was disappointed at the attitude of the staff initially who told me that all European hotels take a deposit in cash only, which was not true as I know because I have stayed in quite a few places!! Overall, the hotel was good. I don't know if the way we were treated was anything to do with being young and looking fairly vulnerable but I think the welcome was not a reflection on the hotel rooms at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable + more!”
Reviews.Author: Dianne H
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eden Manor, 3 nights in Feb 2012. Rooms decent size & very modern. Breakfast great - good choice of hot and cold, toast, pastries, cereals, juices tea & coffee. Not too far by tram from centre, number 9 from Central about 10 minutes. Very helpful staff with directions and help with tram and bus numbers. The price was great - booked with Otel.com. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a clean and comfortable stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Guilherme D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply fantastic!!! Me and my husband has stayed in Eden Hotel for 3 nights and everything we need was gently attended by the staff! The room that we stayed was large (for the european standard!) and the breakfast was really good. The only bad thing is that the hotel is not so close to the center, but you can get the public transportation in the front of the hotel!!! If someday I come back to Amsterdam I will stay again in the Manor Hotel for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kelvin20
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a very fine area, served by several trams. We booked early and got a 50% discount, and when we arrived there we even got upgraded to a luxury room with a big bath. Very friendly staff. The room was clean, spotless and tidy, although not so airy. On the whole, it's a very new and clean hotel with nice decoration. The restaurant was OK, but extremely overpriced, so we just avoided it.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Zip42186424
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean and comfortable hotel with helpful staff. Very handy for exploring and lovely restaurant. Did order a double bed but had two single beds with single duvets pushed together. Also an unexpected 150 Euro bond to pay on arrival. Would definitely recommend to other travellers however.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AlterAthens
Reviews.Content: Spacious, renovated hotel, with very nice rooms, high ceilings, big windows and free Wi-fi. The bathrooms are clean and comfortable and the furnishing is modern. The hotel is situated in a very convenient location, not far from the city center, near a metro station. The stuff is helpful, but the service is a little bit unpersonal for my taste. As far as the hotels restaurant is concerned, it is supposed to serve italian food, but believe me, there is still a long way for this kitchen to accomplish that claim. Look for bargains and good deals, since the hotel offers many.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location, not too far from the center, Easy transport links, Tram stop right outside the hotel. Hotel very clean, friendly staff. Modern funky design to rooms, with a fresh new feel. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, fresh and good value”
Reviews.Author: jabdool
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after securing a good deal whilst at the RAI for an exhibition. It's not in the centre of town but close enought by taxi and team to the RAI and city centre. It's newly refurbished and the rooms are in great condition and modern. The breakfast was fine with a minimal but adequate selection. Everywhere was clean and tidy too. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious and modern.”
Reviews.Author: TianaandFrankie
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good- just a number 9 tram all the way from Centraal. The hotel itself is very clean and spacious and the staff were very helpful. The rooms have everything you need and it was very clean and modern. My only criticism is the bed was two singles put together so one of us would fall through the gap in the night.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding all round good hotel great value”
Reviews.Author: Summersarah
Reviews.Content: I am 24 years old and went in a group of six over 3 2 bed rooms every thing about the hotel was top notch from extremely clean,modern,fresh,and comfortable! We ate in the hotel several times and was brilliant every time little bit pricy but u get what u pay for great food!!!! We went to Amsterdam to do the young person thing drink smoke ect and was worried about being to far out but was great location as had tram stop right out side and the number 9 came 7 times an hour!!!! It was 12euros for 48 hour ticket and could jump on and off as and when . The last tram back was 12:30 so we was getting a taxi and that was only 12 euros! There are 2 convenience stores within 200 yars of the hotel one even late night booze. I could not fault this hotel in any way the staff couldn't be more helpful if they couldn't answer ur question they would be on the Internet getting it for u ! I will defiantly be going back but will be taking my family this time and this hotel is brilliant for everyone! I also believe that they position guests according to there type of trip because it seemed to me the position of our room was out the way of older quieter guest to avoid upset which was good as probly was a bit loud when rolling in eirly hours of the morning ! But no complaints and every one was nice . This is a must stay hotel !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: W_R_12186338
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a 2 night mid-week break. I checked in to the Hotel before the official check in time of 3 pm, this was not a problem for the girl at reception who was more than happy to grant my request for a room at the front of the hotel with a balcony. I found the hotel itself to be run very well , and the staff to be most plesent and helpful at all times. The location of the hotel is about a 20 min brisk walk into the centre of the city. There is a Tram stop directly outside the hotel with a very frequent tram service into the centre which takes about 10 min, there is a 24 hour trevel ticket available( For use on all trams) to buy when you board the tram, for a cost of just â‚¬ 7 per day. The rooms in the hotel are decorated in a very modern style which i found most comfortable. The en-suit is well kitted out and well designed. There are also 2 PC in the lobby with free 24/7 access to the internet. All in all a fantastic stay in a great hotel with excellent staff. The only thing i found the room did not have was a music/ rodio channell on the T.V. as i really enjoy listening to music rather than watching TV, but would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Both "cool" and extremely comfortable--highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: flannery
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We had a large ground-floor room with a private patio. The bed was large and comfortable; the bath had both a large tub with jets and spacious shower. Decor sort of mid-century modern, but cozy and comfortable. Lamps were well-placed. tall ceilings, wooden floor, huge windows with easy and effective curtains. Just a well thought- out place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but spendy”
Reviews.Author: HUSA4342
Reviews.Content: Staff was outstanding, parking and internet worked out to be like 60 bucks a day! Room was super cool, very trendy. Pot cafe right next door, tram is close for a quick trip to the square.

Reviews.Title: “Not coming back”
Reviews.Author: Helen0123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights as our winter break (we are a 30 y.o. couple). Of course, we chose this hotel because of the reviews on Tripadvisor. The hotel administration, as well as their cleaning service, is completely uncoordinated and offers a bad service. The check-in day we were asked to wait some additional time (after 15h) to be able to get to our room. Even on the first day, the room was not clean. We experienced several issues, like no replacement of towels, dust everywhere... and even worse: One day they left our door open. I am not going to write all the misadventures and deficiencies that we had here, because it is not worth it. At the end, no apology from management was send to us. Summary: bad hotel mainly due to its bad service, dirty rooms and overpriced (and simple) breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Shirley I
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at Eden Manor Hotel, fantastic decor, helpful staff, rooms spotless and excellent facilities, TV in room had several English channels including BBC1 and BBC2. Had breakfast only. A la carte breakfast menu is better value , but you need to ask for this, otherwise it is 17.50 euros. Tram service excellent into centre even over Xmas period. Can walk in to centre approx 30 minute walk. Only comment would be is the bar maybe lacks character and not enough comfy seats. Would recommend hotel. Mature couple who stayed with son ( age 21) and would all stay again.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: shalin35
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel with my father and 4 year old son. The hotel looked very impressive and he reviews good so we were looking forward to our stay. They also sent a welcome email a few days before arrival which was a good service. On arrival check in staff were friendly and the porter give us the history of the hotel on the way to our room and was very pleasant.The room was bright and spacious however house keeping provided a very poor service. The floor was carpeted and not hoovered the entire duration of our stay and with a 4 year old it got quite messy and given he has asthma it was not good. We left towels in the shower for changing and found them hanging on the towel rail on return to the room that day, they were stained which was how we knew they were the same towels. None of the work tops were cleaned down and had ring stains from glasses and soap that dripped from the dispenser also stayed the duration and was not cleaned. While I apprecciate we stayed over Christmas and the hotel was not at full capacity and a better standard should have been provided. We also ordered breakfast from room service on Christmas morning as a treat and at 45 euros for two persons had high expectations and were very disappointed, the cooked breakfast was cold and the promise of danish pastries and bread with butter and preserves turned out to be some bread and 2 stale crossants minus butter or preserves, when we phoned reception to request them we were told it would be sent but nothing arrived. Definately not value for money and no reduction was offered on complaint. The tray was still in the room when we returned later that day so we sat it in the hallway and on retrun to the hotel that night after a show found it was still sitting there and a fly buzzing around it, very unimpressed. We drank in the bar twice during our stay and found we had to wait long periods of time for service as the barmen kept wandering off into the restuarant or down the hallway and you'd have to go looking for them and shout across to the restuarant which again was poor service. On check out we found a very rude and unhelpful receptionist who never once asked if everything was ok or if we enjoyed our stay and when we asked for somewhere to store our bags we were met with a glare that would turn milk sour. The hotel is a ten minute tram ride to the centre and trams run from outside the hotel failry frequently, you can purchase all day travel cards for 7 euro each which allows you to travel around and use the quiter location of the hotel as a good base. I have however stayed in Amsterdam many times and there are better hotels with much better service and standards so I was somewhat very disappointed and would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Foodwi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Arrived 3 hours early for check in with the hope of dropping our bags off. The staff on reception upgraded us to a better room which was ready! The room was ultra modern with all amenities and very very comfortable. Breakfast was included in price and was excellent. Lot of choice. The hotel is on the outskirts of the centre but there is a team stop directly outside. About 10 minutes tram journey into centre or a 20-25 minute pleasant walk. The staff were very obliging and te room was cleaned every day. All in all and excellent hotel. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rom1desbois
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel, ont very far from the center but out of the hyperactif touristic area. The bicycle rental organises at the lobby is a great service. We loved the fitness center which is not in the hÃ´tel but at a very close distance, very good equipment and very clean. The breakfast was good but also very Bush on sunday morning. Anyway, the expÃ©rience was great and WE serre very satisfied by our choice

Reviews.Title: “Good new hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dmsamuel
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Eden Manor Hotel in June 2011, just a few days after the opening of the hotel. I've got a cheap price then. The hotel lookes like fine, great rooms. The location is ok, just in front of the hotel is a tram stop, from where you can get easily into the city center.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwild2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for 3 nights -- we were given a room on the ground- floor facing the street. At first we thought it would be noisy, but it was ok -- hardly heard anything, slept through the night comfortably. The room has high-ceiling, decor is very trendy and modern, the king- size bed was very comfy, flat-screen tv, wooden floors, complimentary 1-day in room wi-fi. We did not have breakfast at the hotel - so can't comment on that, and we're not really heavy into heavy breakfast -- but the room has hot water maker, instant coffee, tea and hot coco. Hotel is not in the center, a short tram ride (catch tram nr. 9 in front of the hotel) brings you in the center. We even walked to the center on our first night -- it was about 30 minutes walk. The hotel is very close ( 5-7 min. Walk) to Tropen Museum (Tropical Museum). Definitely recommend a visit. We really like the Eden Manor -- we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Lenderz
Reviews.Content: A bit late with this review, but my Partner and I stayed in this hotel over the Summer holidays. I had booked before the hotel had opened, and did my research prior to booking. I liked the idea of staying in the hotel as it was newly built and expected the quality to be high. The major negative I have to raise is that the check in period was a nightmare, we arrived from the airport a little early and they didn't have our room ready, this was our fault and not an issue, reception offered to take our bags and suggested we went into the city whilst they prepared our room. On our return we were given our key and told that they'd send the bags up. So far so good. However, when we arrived at the room it wasn't the room we had booked. I had specifically checked their rooms before making the booking and had paid extra for a room with a bath rather than just a shower, a â€œking size bedâ€� and a view of the garden. The room we had been given had no bath, two single beds pushed together rather than a kingsize bed and no garden view. So I popped down to reception to see if a mistake had been made, the receptionist spoke to the manager and came back and told me that it was the room I had booked and that nothing could be done. So I went back to my room, checked my email on my iPad to ensure that I hadn't made a mistake, and checked the description of the room I had booked on their website, and back to reception I went and showed them their website, the room description and asked for the situation to be resolved. I was again told that there was nothing they could do, and that they had no rooms with kingsize beds at all and that the website was in error. I was very unhappy about this and went back to the room to inform my fiancÃ©e who was disappointed as this wasn't the romantic break that we had planned. I then reception called us and apologised for the situation, and I told them that it wasn't good enough, and that I hadn't got the room I'd paid for. The receptionist was very apologetic but insisted that the rooms that we had booked didn't exist. She then called back AGAIN stating that she had spoken to the manager and there were two rooms available that she would like us to look at, she came and collected us from the room and the first room she showed us was EXACTLY as the description had been on the website, a Kingsize bed that she had previously insisted they didn't have, a bath that she had previously said they had no rooms available with and a garden view. We didn't see the second room on offer as that was exactly what I had paid for and what I had wanted, but it took the best part of 2 hours to sort out and some stress and upset on our half that was unnecessary if they had given us the correct room in the first place. The rest of the stay was uneventful, other than the maid service not replenishing the coffee/tea one day we were perfectly happy, the bath was lovely and large and fit two people easily, the bed was clean and comfy and the rest of the room was modern stylish and well fitted. The restaurant was pleasant too and I wish I could remember the name of the lady who served us who was very jolly and pleasant in there and made the meal memorable. I would stay at the Eden Manor again, but I would warn all people planning to stay there to make sure they get the room they pay for if they book a Deluxe room, as they seem to try to palm people off into the cheaper â€œSuperiorâ€� rooms. You shouldn't have to complain so much so many times and be lied to when paying extra for a room, and I travel frequently and this is the first â€œEdenâ€� hotel I've stayed in and gave me the worst first impression I've ever experienced in a hotel. Over all its an nice location, most of the staff were very pleasant, the waitress in the restaurant and the concierge in particular deserve a mention. But I don't like being lied to, especially when spending so much money for a week stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy w free wifi”
Reviews.Author: Marays
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, although a tiny bit far away from the city centre but the tram n bus is a step away. The rooms r airy n breathy, w cofi n tea maker. Not many amneties in bathroom. Free wifi n v v lovely staff esp Minuo - the concierge who gave us excellent dinning recommendations,followed up on our lost baggage n was v v pleasant. Restaurant serves v good food too. Will definitely come back

Reviews.Title: “A super hotel”
Reviews.Author: n4dave
Reviews.Content: I had to move Hotels on the day as my original ( Downtown Amsterdam) was a hole and this hotel had a room free on the day. Lovely rooms , nice size , comfortable bed , luxury hotel and not a luxury price ! The Hotel is 10 minutes from Light Square but not many places to eat by the Hotel so I had supper in the restaurant which for me was very expensive and not worth the money at all ( sorry )

Reviews.Title: “Typical international business class hotel”
Reviews.Author: steveAsserballeskov
Reviews.Content: A converted hospital, nicely decorated with comfortable modern rooms. Service was friendly and attentive. Beakfast was a little disappointing and car parking is a nightmare. The hotel has only a few parking places which need to be reserved (they lost our reservation) it is very difficult to park anywhere legally in this area. location is good only a short cab ride to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: letterkenny1
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and the staff were excellent and the restaurant and bar was very good. It is about 15 minutes from the city centre by tram or bike, we did not use the taxi's so I do not know how much they cost. The rooms were comfortable and clean, We did not do the Breakfast buffet which seemed a little expensive. we bought breakfast across the street in a store. If you like quite and a good nights sleep and do not mind traveling to and from the city we would recommend this hotel. If you do not want to learn the trams or rent a bike you should stay closer to the city

Reviews.Title: “Modern, stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amy W
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel using frequent flier miles - the hotel was fresh and new! The property had fun, quirky decor and all the amenties we wanted. The buffet breakfast was wonderful - fresh fruit, cereals, yogurt and a coffee/espresso/latte machine, and the restaurant setting was quite nice. There is a tram stop (#9) right outside the door that will take you straight to Centraal Station. We were on the top floor & could open the windows & look down on the backyard area & let in the breeze. We would stay here again. Only complaint was that in the room, the area by the mirror was open to the bedroom area. This might be very stylish in terms of interior decorating, but is quite lacking in practicality. If traveling alone, this is not an issue - but please, doesn't everyone at least want the OPTION of being able to have privacy in the bathroom???

Reviews.Title: “Quirky in a modern twist”
Reviews.Author: Lp3506
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, no complaints staying at this hotel, would recommend this hotel to anyone, clean, modern and very quirky!

Reviews.Title: “kooky, simple and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: ustaza
Reviews.Content: We booked for our one night in Amsterdam before a drive into Germany. An early arrival didn't cause any problem and the staff could not have been more pleasant and helpful. It was hailing on arrival but it didn't seem to dampen their enthusiam. The location is convenient, not too far from the airport, parking is charged but it efficient. The decoration is pretty in your face, bright and young (hence the kooky!) but the rooms were well organised. Of course not large but clean and neat. I was surpised not to find any shower cap or toiletries or even a face cloth (wash cloth). Liquid soap is in a dispenser on the wall. But hey, this isn't five star after all. Tea making facilities in the room are fine. The windows open, which would be super in warmer weather but we left them closed in late October! Breakfast buffet wasn't so great so we opted for the healthy option. It was cornflaked which surprised us... no muesli but the fresh fruit was just fine. The road outside is quiet thanks to the triple glazing and we saw hundreds of personalised bicycles carring babies, toddlers,shopping. Really interestsing coming from Hong Kong where so few can be seen. Generally this is good value for a city centre hotel in Amsterdam where prices are generally high. You might need your sunglasses for the decor of bright red crosses everywhere, on carpets, walls..... The friendliness makes up for the in your face design. The bed was two singles togther with separate duvets but it worked out fine.

Reviews.Title: “A gem. New, Clean, Spacious - just what was required”
Reviews.Author: swiss_voyager83
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a late flight and checked in around 9pm. Not sure if the hotel had sold my room but I was upgraded from standard double to a junior suite! Amazing. The room was on the large side. Bathroom included a bath and separate shower. Toilet was separate. Wonderful Ritual toiletries and included all the things a real 4 star should have and then some - slippers, toothbrush, sewing kit, nail fail, shaving set etc,.. There were also 2 tv's in the room. Not really necessary 1 facing the bed and another facing the seating area. Huge bed and long enough for my 5'11 frame. Plenty of tea and coffee and hot chocolate. And a complimentary bottle of water in the fridge. Downside was that I was on the ground floor. No noise from above--ceiling was about 15 ft or more but I didn't like being on the ground floor. Breakfast was 17 euros! daylight robbery but not much different to prices of many European hotels I've stayed in. I chose it because I wanted convenience and you can eat as much as you want - so make sure you are hungry. I think there are cheaper alternatives if you don't want the full buffet. Overall a really pleasant experience, clean room, comfortable bed, friendly staff and would definitely return here! Recommend for anyone who doesn't necessarily want to stay in the red-light district.

Reviews.Title: “Location not optimal, but still very much worth it.”
Reviews.Author: PedroFuego73
Reviews.Content: Not in center of things, but right next to tram stop. Rooms a little odd in design, but still quite nice. Didn't have breakfast there. Wifi not fastest, but still free.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent, welcoming and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Cath34980
Reviews.Content: We spent two night in this hotel in Oct 2011. The service was second to none, the Concierge couldn't do enough for us - right down to selecting a bike for us to go to his recommended Thai take-away restaurant, not to mention the famous flock of flying green parrotts overhead that had escaped and multiplied! The room was immaculate and spacious and our windows overlooked the main street giving us a bird's eye view on life in Amsterdam. The bathroom with walk in shower, WC and sink was equipped with a decent hair dryer and plenty of shower products. I would definitely recommend this hotel and go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: king_Shoreham
Reviews.Content: Just checked out this morning (have already booked back in for next Tuesday), Have stayed in three different Eden's now and this is the best. Room for Amsterdam was large (and yes the modern glass door to the large bathroom is something to get used to although it is frosted). Food in restaurant was very good just not cheap, but in this city you get what you pay for, if money is a problem there is supermarket down the road and there are some nice bars e.g Cafe Kiujper which serves Dutch and Belgium beers on tap. Pata Negra II a most authentic tapas bar is 50 meters away as well .. .All in all nice rooms, friendly helpful staff and good location, Station is a 2 min walk, tram 9 stops outside and 7 and 3 trams round the corner

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST hotels I have put my foot in!!”
Reviews.Author: SuccessMalta
Reviews.Content: I just want to say: WOW! I have personally worked in the service and travel business (including hotels) for many years, and Eden Manor was a very pleasant surprise! AMAZING rooms, huge, with terrace (on mine), very quiet, very fresh and new, luxurious, extremely comfy, amazing staff, all the amenities you will need! It will take you only around 10 min. with tram to central station, and walking would only be 30-40 min max. The hotel is next to a huge wonderful park, a coffeeshop, supermarkets, cheap shops and cheap massage places. It is a quiet friendly area, and perfect to "come back home" to, after a busy day in the heart/center. Also very close to the awesome Artis Zoo and Botanical garden! The bar/restaurant is very modern, very good staff, and every person I met in the hotel was super friendly, nice and helpful. And lets talk about the value: It is PERFECT! You will not get anything close to this good for the price, under normal circumstances. I have stayed in many 5-star hotels which does not compare close to this. Hotel is only around 6 months old, so obviously, everything is super new too. STAY STAY STAY!!

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: wackyjackyNortheast
Reviews.Content: stayed here recently room was spacious and bathroom lovely everything nice and clean we were not pleased to have to single beds pushed together with 2 seperate duvets also downside to room 2 tea bags 2 coffee sachets and only cream asked for some replacements on way out when we got back later on they had left us 1 more t bag and i more sachet coffee we bought milk from delicatessan opposite the only toiletries supplied were shower gel on wall and hand wash on wall didnt get towels changed second day hotel wanted 17 euros continental breakfast and extra 5 for full breakfast we ate at a small restaurant 2 blocks down glass chardonnay 3 euros meals reasonable prices our opinion of this hotel is that it is a 3 star with 4 star prices tram no 9 outside hotel very good service

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness leaves alot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: kredman_cetologist
Reviews.Content: The Good: *Not too far from the city centre & if you don't like to walk, public transport is easy to get to. *Very close to Artis Zoo & the Botanic Gardens. *Safes in each room for your valuables. *Mini fridges in each room... very handy seeing breakfast can set you back E17.50!! There's a superstore round down the road. *The restaurant was expensive but the food was very good. *Our room was near the bar but sleeping was fine. The Bad *The bathroom was not what we call private. A frosted door (with gap down the side) & windows!! let you watch your room mate sat on the toilet. If you share a room with someone you either need to be good friends or stare fixedly at the TV. I know the Dutch are slightly more uninhibited than us Brits but really. *Single beds are single beds. Double beds are single beds pushed together. I guess that makes the rooms more flexible. I just worry about people falling between the two. *Thermostats are set on high. This'll probably be less of a problem as summers get colder & wetter. *Breakfast is expensive. Best to get ingredients from the local superstore. The Ugly *Cleanliness is not next to godliness in this place. Hair was found in the shower. The throw on the end of the bed had seen better days. The used coffee cup was removed but the one with the dirty spoon in never moved. Oh & my room mate wished he hadn't looked under the bed. It hadn't been hoovered in a looooong time. *And I'll mention the windows into the bathroom again. Did they run out of bricks? In closing, this hotel is ok. It looks very swish on entering into the main reception. However, the hotel is let down greatly by the cleanliness which seems to be a second thought. And the continental breakfast is extremely overpriced. Oh & be warned. City tax will be included in your final bill. We have no idea what this is but it works out as an extra E4.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by the horrendous corridor decor!”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 nights stay with friends for my 25 wedding anniversary. Although slightly further out than I would have wanted, for the money it was such good value - it was a lovely place, really helpful and friendly staff - couldn't fault anyone, but the maitre de of the restaurant was especially so. Comfortable and spotless rooms, with very a comfy bed! and the breakfast was excellent. Really if you had to choose between this hotel, slightly further out (approx 12 minutes on the No. 9 tram) or someone less nice but nearer the centre - then I would choose this hotel everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Alex-gad
Reviews.Content: My wife spent 4 nights in this hotel and attested that it was a worthwhile stay. Though not in the deep heart of Amsterdam it was 3 tram stops from Rembrandt aquare. The room was clean. The service was impeccable and the breakfast was delicious. The surrounding was soothingly quiet. The only drawback was the lack of airconditining in the room.

Reviews.Title: “High standard hotel, but terrible sleep because of creaking floors”
Reviews.Author: LongTalker
Reviews.Content: Everything in this hotel is modern and in good shape (if slightly in bad taste, as you can suspect when you see how the corridors are decorated), however while staying here for 4 nights, we have had 4 nights of terrible sleep, because of creaking noises from the room above. I guess we were unfortunate enough to have as upstairs neighbours people who for some reason *really* liked to walk up and down their room at night, however the problem lies of course with the superficial refurbishment of the (otherwise very beautiful) old building that houses the hotel. The staff were very nice and polite, and asked the people upstairs several times to keep the walking to a minimum during the night - a bit of a funny request, since everyone should be allowed to do what they want in their room, but nonetheless one we expected them to understand, given that this was nobody's fault but the building's. They didn't, unfortunately, which meant we were awoken every single night by terrible creaking noises from all the walking above. Hard to give an overall average here, I guess 3 stars would be reasonable given all of the above. I guess I would only stay in this hotel again if I were guaranteed a room at the top floor!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel - worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: JoanneGoods
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to couples and families. The rooms are a good size, bathrooms are very clean and beds are very comfy. The Tram picks up very close to the hotel and takes you to all the sites. Food was very good in the hotel too. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved hotel”
Reviews.Author: molly101Dudley
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for a long weekend ,never been to amsterdam before, but will be going back to this hotel ,is was fantastic . the room we had was large on the ground floor ,2 tvs even though nothing much on them, large bathroom with hair dryer and bathroom products , 2 single beds pushed togeather ,but really comfy , mini bar with 1 free bottle of water. staff are really friendly and helpful . trams very close by . we didnt have breakfast there as always went out. very modern and good looking place.you do have to give your credit card number in when you check in ,just incase you order room service ,and remember you have to pay a visitors tax when checking out . really good price ,but do look around as you may get it cheaper . well worth stopping there .

Reviews.Title: “Looks good, but has issues.”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_Trolley
Reviews.Content: We booked a "double superior" room and were put in a room where two singles were shoved together. When mentioned to a member of reception, we were told this was "normal for a superior room". Is it really? They said they'd transfer us to a double room two mornings later when one would become available. The first room (apart from the bed issue), was nice. A reasonable size, with enough wardrobe space (even for me). Nicely styled throughout with a tiled wetroom-style bathroom. The second room (still with two twins pushed together, but with a double mattress cover, was bigger, with a couple extra chairs, but it was on the ground floor, so the (one) window only opened an inch or so, and because the A/C wasn't working, it was stifling in there! We mentioned lack of A/C to staff, who (with almost a shrug of the shoulder) said they'd take a look, but honestly didn't seem to care. Nobody looked at it and we stayed sweltering. I was disappointed that we had to continually ask for coffee/dried milk as they weren't replenished every day. Also, shower gel. Whilst we were there, the room didn't see as much of a hoover or a mop. The bed sheets were changed once in the 5 days we stayed in the second room and the room wasn't tidied at all, in any way, shape or form. The wifi was a pain as it kept logging out every 15/20 mins or so and every day needed a new faffy code. The breakfast buffet wasn't bad, but at 17.50euro, it was overpriced. Positives: Hotel is a short tram ride from all the activity. The trams are pretty regular and inexpensive. One extremely friendly gentleman at reception. I'm embarrased to say I forgot his name, but he is a very tall (more salt than pepper haired) chap. His welcoming face and banter was quite refreshing! There's a great kebab shop across the road! It's such a shame that this new hotel has obviously had a lot spent on it and yet, still fails to work.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Dandelion223
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Amsterdam, and we were impressed with the hotel right from arriving in the taxi. We were thrilled to find out on arrival that our room had a balcony, which was shared with two other rooms but great to relax on. The room itself was very clean, a good size and the bathroom was well equipped. The bed was extremely comfortable too. We experienced a very high standard of service from all the staff we encountered; the concierge was very helpful (advised us that fridge in room was empty and we could fill it from corner shop across the road, which we did). Also, I was unfortunately pickpocketed on a tram, and the staff again were very considerate, phoning the police station to find out how we could report this. Our only slight gripe would be that the room was very warm on our first night, once we had adjusted the climate control it did cool down but this took a while. Overall a super hotel, very clean and modern with helpful staff and good proximity to the centre of the city. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!! Family Friendly & Great Location For Park & Zoo!”
Reviews.Author: MikeFromWrexham
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week for 3 nights. We had a family room which was more than large enough for 2 Adults & a 5 year old. We stayed in room 37 which is at the top of a coridor just through the Blue Bar area. This room I believe is classed as a suite and has its own patio area with table & chairs. The bathroom facilities were excellent 5*. The Hotel uses a selection of 'Rituals' products in the bathroom which are similar to 'Molton Brown'. Bathroom has a 7 feet wide window which looks in to the bedroom. When lying back in the bath you can watch one of the 2 TV's! At the end of the bed is a TV unit with a TV on either side. Very nice linen and pillows and the bed is also very large 6 footer! There is a fridge in the room which is very hand if you wish to stock it with products from the Supermarket across the street! The staff were very friendly towards children and always made us feel very welcome. The Kids menu has a choice of 3 starters - 3 mains & 3 deserts. My son particularly liked the Chicken Sausuage & chips with Apple sauce! I had a very nice Pizza and the remainder of the other food looked really nice. You may be thinking that the Hotel is a little out of the way! Far from it! To be fair I have stayed in the Krasnapolsky on Dam Square and felt a little uneasy as the Red Light district begins at the street along side. It is incredibly easy to get to the Hotel from the Airport! We had 15.50 Euro 72 Hour Transport tickets. (same price for kids!). Plus you have to buy a separate train ticket now to get to Central station. From the Airport the journey to the hotel is 50 minutes. Straight out of arrivals down the escaltor to the Station. Take train to Central Station, get a No. 9 Tram heading to Diemen Sniep! In about 20 minutes you are 150 yards from the Hotel door! Brilliant and easy! All you do is take the No. 9 from outside the Hotel again which this time is heading back to Central Station and get off in Dam Square! The Eden Manor is 200 yards from Oosterpark which is massive! Has a nice path all the way around, a Childrens play area and a massive paddling pool. We played frisbee there one evening and the park was full of locals chilling out and playing volleyball and having barbecues (felt a really nice atmosphere!). Regardless of whether you are staying with kids or not, the Artis Zoo is incredible!! Will take you 3hours plus to do it justice! Nice to spend the whole day there. The localls appeared to be using coupons for a discount at the gate. I suggest you try the website. If yiou have kids under 5, there are seated karts with long handles for you to drag the round in. They cost 2 Euro and save little legs! The zoo is only 4-5 Tram stops on the No.9 also. All stops are called out verbally on the Trams!

Reviews.Title: “housekeeping let it down”
Reviews.Author: Lesleyc1703
Reviews.Content: The Hotel had only been opened for 6 weeks yet we had a bulb out in the bathroom and no plug in the sink. The bulb was replaced after asking, on day 2 but the box lay until we had to bin it. No toiletries were provided by housekeeping and we had to continually ask at reception. After a 5 day stay we still had no plug for the sink! The front of house staff were polite, friendly and helpful. "Air con" was very poor due to it being an air re-circulating system, so much so we had to take duvet out of cover and sleep only with the cover. Transportaion system excellent, location excellent. Tram stop outside hotel and central to most attractions. Overall a decent hotel, and we would stay again but certainly not in the hotter months. It would have to work harder to become the 4 * it advertises itself as.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a little bit of luxury during your Amsterdam break”
Reviews.Author: chr123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in July and were very impressed with the hotel, service and facilities. All very modern, new and clean. Room was modern with flat screen tv, sleek wet room and power shower and comfy beds. Location was good too, about 10 minutes on the tram outside the city centre. If you're looking to be bang in the middle of the sights though this probably isn't the hotel for you. Only criticism was the over-priced breakfast... at 17.50 euros each for a buffet style breakfast I think this is a bit excessive. For this reason we only had the breakfast in the hotel on one of the two mornings we were there - had the price been more reasonable we would have had breakfast there both mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and poor management”
Reviews.Author: oegstgeest
Reviews.Content: We booked our rooms online, expecting very high standards for this new hotel outside the city centre (and therefore supposed to be of better quality than those in the tourist area). We were somewhat disappointed that the bathroom in one of the rooms had not been cleaned. The new room we were offered was not as confortable, did not have a bath, mattresses were not in order. and the coffee and tea tray had not been renewed. The air circulation system in the other room only provided hot air, making it impossible to have a good night's sleep. Staff was not very friendly and even had an attitude when we reported these inconveniences. Although it may occur that a new hotel has technical problems, the way staff (except for the gentleman) went about finding solutions and, mostly, the attitude of two ladies at the reception desk, was inappropriate. For what we got, rooms were largely overpriced and not worth four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gazaj
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for acouple of nights from the 18.07.11. Booked this hotel as we were going to Amsterdam to see Take That concert. The Hotel was only opened in June so no reviews were there before we booked. The hotel is about ten minutes tram ride from the city centre. Take tram 9 from central station, Dam Square, etc and it stops about 100m from the hotel. The staff were really good, we arrived at 10:30am and new that our check-in was not until 3pm, the hotel offered to store our luggage so we could go out. The concierge was really helpful he asked us if we need any advise for sightseeing, maps, etc. The rooms were really nice and clean, shower was in the style of a wet room. I booked breakfast at the time of booking this room, most sites showed room only but we booked in advance, the cost locally was 17.50 euro which to be honest was a little much and would not have had breakfast in the hotel if I had not pre paid it. Breakfast was Eggs, bacon, sausage and the the usual continental. The hotel check-out is 12pm but again they offered to store our luggage as our flight home was not to late evening, so we went sightseeing and just jumped on the tram back to the hotel to collect it before we headed off to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: kimber0668
Reviews.Content: Perfect location out of the noise of Amsterdam. Easy access with tram #9 from Central Station. Excellent service from all staff! Dont think we could have found a better home for 4 nights in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Newest hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: skivaz
Reviews.Content: Newest Hotel in town (still smells of new), not very central but with a 15-minutes tram (n.9) trip you are in Dam Square. Rooms are a decent size for Amsterdam. Close to Oosterpark. We got a room in the back, very quiet. Buffet Breakfast is expensive but having tea/coffee making facilities in the room and a Supermarket just in front, is strongly suggested to have breakfast in room, or just a simple coffe and croissant at the bar. Pity that having quite a big site and having created the Hotel from scratch, the only facility is a bar/restaurant, it would have been nice if the ground floor rooms were sacrified for a gym and/or Spa or Swimming pool. Reasonable price. Will stay again if the opportunity arise.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lack of aircon a real problem”
Reviews.Author: cyclingmad2011
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at the last minute, good quiet location if you want to keep away from the masses, but right next to the no 9 tram in and out of town. Hotel is new, in an old building, the rooms were lovely and the staff were very helpful. Unfortunately there was a downside. The hotel has decided to be green, and not installed airconditioning, instead there is an air circulation system which is meant to cool the room. You might not imagine that this would be a problem, and perhaps we were just unlucky, but staying on the top floor in the summer the heat was unbearable during the night, especially as the circulation unit switched itself off every hour, and having the windows open wasn't really possible due to the noise from the street outside. Oh, and if you're travelling with a bicycle, don't expect to be able to put it in the luggage room, you'll need to chain it to the railings at the front of the hotel and hope it's still there in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, new staff....that lack admin skills!”
Reviews.Author: SRS1973
Reviews.Content: It is not just the hotel that was new, but the staff as well!! We stayed at the hotel as part of a group and had arrived early,(the rest of the group joined later from London) We had informed the very friendly gentleman at the front desk that we are part of a tour group and he still insisted that we pay a booking fee! (still cannot explain why this was asked) One of the rooms was not ready (family room) and he gladly accommodated us by offering to store the luggage while we go site seeing. When the tour director called she inquired whether we had arrived and was informed by the front desk staff that we are yet to check in!!!!! ( we had already arrived early morning and was site seeing in Amsterdam) When the tour director arrived and found us waiting she asked the lady at the front desk and her response was quite simple, that she only started work the afternoon and was unaware that we had checked in! SHOCKING! Eventually when we arrived back to the hotel from our group excursion, the room that was originally allocated to my sister and her family was given to someone else and she was not given a family room! When the tour director again approached the front desk he in amazement said that it was a triple room with an additional bed. He didn't believe my brother in law that it was not a triple room (as if we don't know the difference) and then called up to the room and asked if there was a third bed! Only upon hearing this from my sister in the room did he act upon this and asked one of the porters to bring a bed up to their room!! AGAIN Shocking service to say the least. The breakfast was average with very unfriendly staff! Location good as the tram stop is just opposite the hotel. And our booking fee.... back from our holiday and still waiting!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, definitely recommend a visit!”
Reviews.Author: conrad1402
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at the Eden Manor Amsterdam Hotel just the night before, and found it to be one of the cheapest 4* hotels in the city on LateRooms. As the hotel is relatively new (I think it opened around the 10th of June 2011) there weren't many reviews on sites such as this one, but I kept an open mind and was most pleasantly surprised. The hotel isn't far from the centre, don't be put off by the fact it isn't on Dam Square (the main city square). Hotels in close proximity of Dam Square tend to be overpriced, or of poor quality with a few exceptions of course. Transportation wise, I'd recommend getting a 24/48/72 (whichever suits) hour card for unlimited travel with GVB (the company that runs the trams, metro and bus services in the city) which can be obtained relatively cheaply and there's a tram stop right outside the hotel. Travel time from Central Station to the hotel is about 10 minutes by tram, or a 30 minute walk. As you would expect the hotel is very clean (unused) and modern. There are two reception desks to check-in at. There's also a (very!) keen concierge readily available. The rooms are well-sized with everything you could ask for. The bed is amazing, and I had the best nights sleep I've ever had in a hotel. Behind the bed is a LARGE canvas-type piece of artwork which I think vary from room to room. In our room, 116, was a shot of a beautiful fashion model - it was a great focal point of the room. The bathrooms are spacious - our room didn't have a bath however - and the plumbing all work seamlessly. It seemed to never have been used, or maybe they just have very high cleaning standards. Either way, I was impressed. Love the hotel, and can't wait to go back! Try it for yourself and I'm sure you will not be disappointed.

HotelInfo.Name: The Manor Hotel Amsterdam - Hampshire Eden
HotelInfo.Address: Linneausstraat 89, Amsterdam 1093 EK, The Netherlands
